Package fi.tuni.tamk.tiko.halinenpetr.util

Class ForArrays

java.lang.Object
fi.tuni.tamk.tiko.halinenpetr.util.ForArrays
public class ForArrays
extends java.lang.Object
The class Arrays contains methods for working with arrays and examining them. Everything in this class Arrays is a method for manipulating different kinds of arrays. Some methods are similar to existing java methods, but differ in some way that is required.
Author:
Petr Halinen

      Converts a String array into an int array.

      Returns:

    • contains

      public static boolean contains​(int value, int[] array)
      Returns either true or false depending if given value is found from array.
      Parameters:
      value - the value that is being searched for
      array - the array that is being examined
      Returns:
      true or false depending if the value is found from the array

    • containSameValues

      public static int containSameValues​(int[] array1, int[] array2)
      Returns the number of same values that are contained within the two int arrays that are being examined.
      Parameters:
      array1 - first int array that is being compared
      array2 - second int array that is being compared
      Returns:
      the number of same values contained in the two arrays

    • isUniqueNumber

      public static boolean isUniqueNumber​(int number, int[] uniqueNumArray)
      This method examines an integer array for a number and determines if it is already in said array or not.
      Parameters:
      number - the integer that is being searched for in the array
      uniqueNumArray - int array containing unique numbers
      Returns:
      a boolean value of true or false depending on if the number is unique or already exists in the array.

    • addNumToArray

      public static int[] addNumToArray​(int number, int arraySlot, int[] uniqueNumArray)
      Method inserts int number into the index of the uniqueNumarray that corresponds with integer arraySlot.
      Parameters:
      number - int that is being inserted into array
      arraySlot - the index of array that will recieve the number
      uniqueNumArray - int array that contains the unique numbers
      Returns:
      the int array with the new number added into it

    • zeroArray

      public static int[] zeroArray​(int[] array)
      Method fills int array with number 0
      Parameters:
      array - array that is being filled with 0
      Returns:
      returns array that has 0 in every index

    • isArrayFull

      public static boolean isArrayFull​(int[] array)
      Method checks if given array is full of numbers or not.
      Parameters:
      array - the array that is being checked.
      Returns:
      a boolean value of true or false depending on the array being full or not.

    • printIntArray

      public static void printIntArray​(int[] array)
      Method prints integers from the given int array and adds a space " " after every number.
      Parameters:
      array - the array that is printed

    • collectNumbers

      public static int[] collectNumbers​(int min, int max, int arrayIndex, int[] array, java.lang.String errorMessageNonNumeric, java.lang.String errorMessageNonMinMax)
      This method collects given user input into an int array, while making sure that the given input is an integer and is a unique number. Method collectNumbers uses other methods: Arrays.contains to check for uniqueness of the given input integers, Arrays.addNumToArray for adding the user input into the array and the Arrays.isArrayFull method to determine if the array is already filled.
      Parameters:
      min - the smallest acceptable integer value
      max - the largest acceptable integer value
      arrayIndex - the index of the array into which the current user input is stored (this should be "0", by default)
      array - the int array into which the user inputs are stored
      errorMessageNonNumeric - custom error message for when the input is not an integer
      errorMessageNonMinMax - custom error message for when the input is not within the desired parameters (min and max)
      Returns:
      the array into which the numbers were stored

    • createNewArray

      public static int[] createNewArray​(int size)
      This method creates new int array the size of given parameter.
      Parameters:
      size - the size of int array created
      Returns:
      the created array

    • fillArray

      public static int[] fillArray​(int min, int[] array)
      The method fills an array with integers from the desired number onwards (eg. 1,2,3...), until the array is full.
      Parameters:
      min - the integer from which the method starts
      array - the array that is filled
      Returns:
      the filled array

    • sortArray

      public static int[] sortArray​(int[] array, char order)
      Method is used for sorting an int array. It returns the array sorted in descending or ascending order, depenging on the param given to the method.
      Parameters:
      array - the int array that is going to be sorted
      order - the sorting order, char 'a' for ascending 1,2,3.. and char 'd' for descending 3,2,1.
      Returns:
      the array sorted in the desired order

    • prefixTheArray

      public static java.lang.String[] prefixTheArray​(java.lang.String[] array, java.lang.String prefix)
      This method returns the String array with all the Strings that are shorter than the longest String prefixed with the chosen prefix.
      Parameters:
      array - array to be prefixed
      prefix - the desired prefix String, e.g. "0".
      Returns:
      the array with desired prefix prefixed to all Strings in the array that are shorter than the longest String in the array.

    • intToStringArray

      public static java.lang.String[] intToStringArray​(int[] original)
      This method returns the given int array as a String array.
      Parameters:
      original - the int array that is converted to a String array.
      Returns:
      the original array converted to a String array.

    • printStringArray

      public static void printStringArray​(java.lang.String[] array)
      This method prints a String array with spaces in between the array indexes.
      Parameters:
      array - the array that is printed.

    • prepareArrayForPrint

      public static java.lang.String[] prepareArrayForPrint​(int[] intArray, java.lang.String prefix)
      This method prepares the int array for printing. It converts the int array into a String array by using the method ForArrays.intoStringArray and then prefixes the String array with the method ForArrays.prefixTheArray.
      Parameters:
      intArray - int array that is prepared for printing.
      prefix - the prefix used as a param for the method prefixTheArray.
      Returns:
      a String array that is ready to be printed out with the prefixes in place.
